alert.note: Alert for Indian River; Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 8:34PM EST until January 09 at 9:30PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Melbourne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... St. Lucie County in east central Florida... Southeastern Okeechobee County in east central Florida... Eastern Indian River County in east central Florida... Central Martin County in east central Florida... * Until 930 PM EST. * At 833 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Pointe West to near Treasure Island, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Sebastian, and Stuart. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST for east central Florida. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once to a small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Indian River; Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie
